bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, November 29, 1940

div1.p: Hench is sure Hutchison will find the missing autographed photographs. He corrects a professional title for use in a citation.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, November 29, 1940
div1.p: I am sure you will find these pictures.

By the way, if there is any occasion for you to pub-
lish your citation of me, would you please make the correction
that I mentioned to you. It should have been “President of the
American Rheumatism Association” and not “World Arthritis
Association”. Please make it less inclusive, and save me em-
barrassment. Please also note that my term as president has
expired. It was 1939-40, and the new president went in in June.
But, believe me, you are not going to get back the honorary
degree on that score!
div1.closer:
Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
P. S. Don't worry about the statement “not over
twenty dollars.” Just cross it off. I want the pictures
irregardless.
P.S.H.
